currentDoc:
Should Schools Provide Free Pads and Tampons?

Have you ever experienced period shaming, or “period poverty”? Should schools step in to help? Should schools be required to provide free pads and tampons to students? How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

Have you ever experienced period shaming, or “period poverty”? Should schools step in to help? Should schools be required to provide free pads and tampons to students? How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

People can't help getting periods

Viagra is free

How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

In case I run out of time to explain, in summary:

People can't help getting periods
Periods arrive out of nowhere sometimes and there should be accessible as a fail-safe
Viagra is free
People would be more interested in going to school
That stuff is expensive
1. People can't help getting periods

Have you ever experienced period shaming, or “period poverty”? Should schools step in to help? Should schools be required to provide free pads and tampons to students? How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

In case I run out of time to explain, in summary:

People can't help getting periods
Periods arrive out of nowhere sometimes and there should be accessible as a fail-safe
Viagra is free
People would be more interested in going to school
That stuff is expensive
1eople can't help getting periods
. They are a natural part of life and it is not fair to pin that on someone when they can't control it.

currentDoc:
Should Schools Provide Free Pads and Tampons?

Have you ever experienced period shaming, or “period poverty”? Should schools step in to help? Should schools be required to provide free pads and tampons to students? How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

In case I run out of time to explain, in summary:

People can't help getting periods
Periods arrive out of nowhere sometimes and there should be accessible as a fail-safe
Viagra is free
People would be more interested in going to school
That stuff is expensive
1eople can't help getting periods
. They are a natural part of life and it is not fair to pin that on someone when they can't control it.

Periods can literally happen at any time.

How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

In case I run out of time to explain, in summary:

People can't help getting periods
Periods arrive out of nowhere sometimes and there should be accessible as a fail-safe
Viagra is free
People would be more interested in going to school
That stuff is expensive
1eople can't help getting periods
. They are a natural part of life and it is not fair to pin that on someone when they can't control it.

Periods can literally happen at any time.

How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

In case I run out of time to explain, in summary:

People can't help getting periods
Periods arrive out of nowhere sometimes and there should be accessible as a fail-safe
Viagra is free
People would be more interested in going to school
That stuff is expensive
1eople can't help getting periods
. They are a natural part of life and it is not fair to pin that on someone when they can't control it.

Periods can literally happen at any time. Sometimes they come on suddenly and there is no time to get to a store. Sometimes you can bum a pad or tampon off someone else, but what is someone supposed to do if they aren't? There needs to be

How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

In case I run out of time to explain, in summary:

People can't help getting periods
Periods arrive out of nowhere sometimes and there should be accessible as a fail-safe
Viagra is free
People would be more interested in going to school
That stuff is expensive
1eople can't help getting periods
. They are a natural part of life and it is not fair to pin that on someone when they can't control it.

Periods can literally happen at any time. Sometimes they come on suddenly and there is no time to get to a store. Sometimes you can bum a pad or tampon off someone else, but what is someone supposed to do if they aren't? There needs to be materials available to them for FREE in case of emergencies like this. Nobody should have to walk around staining their clothes because they don't have a pad or tampon.

Viagra is free. Condoms are free. Things that identified men use but identified women have to suffer? Lmao okay. That doesn't make sen

How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

In case I run out of time to explain, in summary:

People can't help getting periods
Periods arrive out of nowhere sometimes and there should be accessible as a fail-safe
Viagra is free
People would be more interested in going to school
That stuff is expensive
1eople can't help getting periods
. They are a natural part of life and it is not fair to pin that on someone when they can't control it.

Periods can literally happen at any time. Sometimes they come on suddenly and there is no time to get to a store. Sometimes you can bum a pad or tampon off someone else, but what is someone supposed to do if they aren't? There needs to be materials available to them for FREE in case of emergencies like this. Nobody should have to walk around staining their clothes because they don't have a pad or tampon.

Viagra is free. Condoms are free. Things that identified men use but identified women have to suffer? Lmao okay. That doesn't make sense. If part of this stuff is free, its

currentDoc:
Should Schools Provide Free Pads and Tampons?

Have you ever experienced period shaming, or “period poverty”? Should schools step in to help? Should schools be required to provide free pads and tampons to students? How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

In case I run out of time to explain, in summary:

People can't help getting periods
Periods arrive out of nowhere sometimes and there should be accessible as a fail-safe
Viagra is free
People would be more interested in going to school
That stuff is expensive
1eople can't help getting periods
. They are a natural part of life and it is not fair to pin that on someone when they can't control it.

Periods can literally happen at any time. Sometimes they come on suddenly and there is no time to get to a store. Sometimes you can bum a pad or tampon off someone else, but what is someone supposed to do if they aren't? There needs to be materials available to them for FREE in case of emergencies like this. Nobody should have to walk around staining their clothes because they don't have a pad or tampon.

Viagra is free. Condoms are free. Things that identified men use but identified women have to suffer? Lmao okay. That doesn't make sense. If part of this stuff is free, it should ALL be free.

How are pads and tampons similar to toilet paper, soap, Band-Aids and other products that are already provided in schools? How are they different?

---

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

In case I run out of time to explain, in summary:

People can't help getting periods
Periods arrive out of nowhere sometimes and there should be accessible as a fail-safe
Viagra is free
People would be more interested in going to school
That stuff is expensive
1eople can't help getting periods
. They are a natural part of life and it is not fair to pin that on someone when they can't control it.

Periods can literally happen at any time. Sometimes they come on suddenly and there is no time to get to a store. Sometimes you can bum a pad or tampon off someone else, but what is someone supposed to do if they aren't? There needs to be materials available to them for FREE in case of emergencies like this. Nobody should have to walk around staining their clothes because they don't have a pad or tampon.

Viagra is free. Condoms are free. Things that identified men use but identified women have to suffer? Lmao okay. That doesn't make sense. If part of this stuff is free, it should ALL be free.

People would be inclined to go to school if they knew there was a place that was safe. A bathroom stocked with pads and tampons would help with this - yes, the nurse may have stuff, but some people are

Periods can literally happen at any time. Sometimes they come on suddenly and there is no time to get to a store. Sometimes you can bum a pad or tampon off someone else, but what is someone supposed to do if they aren't? There needs to be materials available to them for FREE in case of emergencies like this. Nobody should have to walk around staining their clothes because they don't have a pad or tampon.

Viagra is free. Condoms are free. Things that identified men use but identified women have to suffer? Lmao okay. That doesn't make sense. If part of this stuff is free, it should ALL be free.

People would be inclined to go to school if they knew there was a place that was safe. A bathroom stocked with pads and tampons would help with this - yes, the nurse may have stuff, but some people are too embarassed

In my opinion, schools should absolutely provide free pads and tampons for several reasons.

In case I run out of time to explain, in summary:

People can't help getting periods
Periods arrive out of nowhere sometimes and there should be accessible as a fail-safe
Viagra is free
People would be more interested in going to school
That stuff is expensive
1eople can't help getting periods
. They are a natural part of life and it is not fair to pin that on someone when they can't control it.

Periods can literally happen at any time. Sometimes they come on suddenly and there is no time to get to a store. Sometimes you can bum a pad or tampon off someone else, but what is someone supposed to do if they aren't? There needs to be materials available to them for FREE in case of emergencies like this. Nobody should have to walk around staining their clothes because they don't have a pad or tampon.

Viagra is free. Condoms are free. Things that identified men use but identified women have to suffer? Lmao okay. That doesn't make sense. If part of this stuff is free, it should ALL be free.

People would be inclined to go to school if they knew there was a place that was safe. A bathroom stocked with pads and tampons would help with this - yes, the nurse may have stuff, but some people are too embarrassed to talk about their issues with someone, even if it's between two women.
